replies.bodyText:
Should I also implment some validation on the APP field?
It doens't make sense with an empty string, and other patterns are likely also not supported by Kubernetes.
replies.author: TueDissingWork

replies.bodyText:
I don't think it's necessary (if someone overrides this value is because they want to do so purposefully), but go ahead if you want.
You have a helper method in https://github.com/fabric8io/kubernetes-client/blob/25c09cd5d790e55407f999b73502344b2d5f6d49/kubernetes-client/src/main/java/io/fabric8/kubernetes/client/utils/KubernetesResourceUtil.java#L275
which can be called once all labels are computed (i.e. createLabels > createAndValidateLabels)
replies.author: manusa

timeline.bodyHTML:
I think this can be safely replaced by

Suggested change
String customAppName = Configs.asString(getConfig(Config.CUSTOM_APP_NAME));
if (customAppName != null && !customAppName.isEmpty()) {
ret.put("app", customAppName);
} else {
// default label is app
ret.put("app", groupArtifactVersion.getArtifactId());
}
/* ... */
/* L58 */ CUSTOM_APP_NAME("customAppName", null);
/* ... */
ret.put("app", getConfig(Config.CUSTOM_APP_NAME, groupArtifactVersion.getArtifactId());
timeline.author: manusa

timeline.body:
I think leaving the config value just as:
```suggestion
    	APP("app", "");
```
would make more sense and is probably better aligned with most of the other enrichers (configuration key matched target property name)

`jkube.enricher.jkube-project-label.app` is also clearer than `jkube.enricher.jkube-project-label.customAppName`
